stories.title: Mercedes-Benz Says Self-Driving Option Ready to Roll

stories.text:
Jetpack Compose is the future of Android UI. Companies and developers do not want to invest hundreds of hours in learning it from scratch.

It took me a few months before Compose clicked. This is coming from someone with 10 years of professional Android experience and a passion in UI development. I saw the benefits of the new framework since day 1, but it took a while for it to feel productive with it.

Because of this, I decided to make it dead simple for companies and devs to use Jetpack Compose. I am writing an eBook that translates everything you know from Views to Compose so that you can use Compose straight away.

The eBook is currently being writen and available for pre-order. I have received some good feedback from people from the Android community so far. Happy to hear your thoughts.

- Alex Styl
stories.title: Show HN: An eBook to save you hundreds of hours in learning Jetpack Compose

stories.text:
Hi guys

I spent my spare time in 2020 and 2021 learning how to put together and operate a backyard observatory.

The linked pic is a composite made with the image composite editor from microsoft research. The input to the compositor looks like this:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KLd-U1lYgnY

I found that this process is a lot faster than creating sequences in sequence generator pro or sharpcap, though it does leave in visible sensor noise that would otherwise be removed by the stacking process.

I've yet to find a decent deconvolver, though i'm probably going to learn some openCV for that.

stories.text: Lots of spam comments are posted to blogs with links handled as nofollow in comments: why? Is this out of date advice novice spammers get from their peers? Do the spammers get any SEO or other benefits?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do spammers comment on blog posts if links are nofollow?
